responses.rationale: The segment expresses a thought about people's desires, not capability or preparedness.
The segment describes a state of being, not capability or preparedness.
The segment describes a state of being, not capability or preparedness.
The segment is a question about information, not a statement of capability or preparedness.
The segment expresses worry, not capability or preparedness.
The segment introduces a topic, not capability or preparedness.
The segment is a question about possibility, not a statement of capability or preparedness.
The segment uses a metaphor to describe spread, not capability or preparedness.
Describes a completed action related to response/capability ('delivered now over half a million vaccine doses').
Describes potential future actions related to control ('blunt the pace', 'figure out what the next phase of control can be').
The segment is a question about future possibility, not a statement of capability or preparedness.
The segment is a question about future possibility, not a statement of capability or preparedness.
Describes progress in research related to development capability ('figuring out how to do it', 'amazing papers out').
Describes progress in research related to development capability ('getting really exciting in terms of understanding and training').
Discusses existing interventions/tools ('lenacapavir') and investment strategy, related to capability.
Discusses potential future use and effectiveness of an intervention ('women could use event-driven PrEP', 'it would probably work well').
Mentions having a strategic vision, which is a form of planning/preparedness.
Describes ongoing work on a strategic plan, which is preparedness ('working on a new refresh of our strategic plan').
Describes a planning document and metrics ('living document', 'refreshed annually', 'metrics'), related to preparedness/safeguards.
Asks about metrics, which relates to surveillance/preparedness ('What are the metrics').
Expresses hope for future realization of interventions, related to capability/tools ('see the promise of the malaria interventions realized').
Describes the effectiveness of interventions ('monoclonal antibodies and the new vaccine... actually reduced malaria').
The segment comments on a study design, not capability or preparedness itself.
Describes a potential future strategy using interventions, related to capability/planning ('comprehensive strategy to use the monoclonals, use the vaccine').
Describes a potential future outcome of a strategy, related to capability/planning ('create a path for serious control').
The segment expresses a feeling, not capability or preparedness.
Mentions ongoing work and a study of a vaccine, related to capability/development ('still work to do', 'study of the experimental vaccine').
Expresses hope for future progress, related to capability/development ('Hopefully we’ll make some inroads there').
The segment expresses a personal feeling, not capability or preparedness.
Describes a future goal involving interventions, related to capability/development ('aim for some incredible game-changing interventions').
The segment reports a factual event (discovery), not capability or preparedness.
Describes actions taken as response measures/safeguards ('will be slaughtered and buried', 'exports... will be restricted').
The segment reports a factual outcome of actions, not capability or preparedness itself.
The segment provides background statistics, not capability or preparedness.
The segment provides historical context, not capability or preparedness.
The segment reports factual events, not capability or preparedness.
Describes actions taken as response measures/safeguards ('will cull nearly 140,000 turkey and chickens').

Describes a measure taken as a safeguard ('temporarily housed to protect their health and welfare').
Describes a future possibility contingent on measures being lifted, related to safeguards ('birds will be able to go outside again').
Describes an action taken related to development/capability ('France has been trialling bird flu vaccines').
States a purpose related to safeguards ('Protect health and welfare').
The segment reports developments and concerns, not capability or preparedness.

The segment expresses concern and suggests precautions, not a statement of existing capability/preparedness without calming.
